conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles.
Image shows colored sticks labeled A, B, C, D, and E with arrows indicating flow direction.
Task is to predict which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles.
Baffles are rectangular sections marked with arrows indicating flow direction.
Arrows labeled A, B, and C indicate flow direction; D and E are not marked with arrows.
Assume D and E are not part of the flow path due to lack of arrows.
Trace the path of the liquid through the baffles following the arrows.
Liquid will flow from the point where arrows point to container labeled D.
The liquid will flow into container D after passing through the baffles.
